newsitem.title: INDIA: India's TELCO up on news of strong sales.
newsitem.headline: India's TELCO up on news of strong sales.

text.p: Shares of leading truckmaker Tata Engineering and Locomotive Company (TELCO) jumped 11.50 rupees, or three percent, to 404.50 on the Bombay bourse in early trade on Wednesday, traders said.
They said investors and speculators were bidders in the stock on reports that the firm had reported a strong growth in vehicle sales in 1996/97.
The Economic Times newspaper said in an unsourced report that vehicle sales had risen 24 percent to 203,800 units in the year-ended March 31, 1997, from 164,100 a year earlier.
But automobile analysts said sales during the year were higher at around 218,000 vehicles.
Company officials were not immediately available for comment. Official automobile data upto the month of March is due later this week.
